messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1187
messages.msgSnippet: by the way, that was 2000 sq ft home, not 200! Johanna Life is the ultimate learning experience! ... From: Valerie Stewart To:
messages.messageBody:
by the way, that was 2000 sq ft home, not 200!
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: Valerie Stewart
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, May 03, 2001 6:51 PM
Subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1187


wow, this post makes me glad to live in Tennessee. we have a 200 sq ft four
bedroom home on ten acres of land and with mortgage, insurance, utilities
and all, we dont pay more than $1200 a month! It costs $25 a year for car
tags. Our property tax was $450 for a year and we have no income tax. Sales
tax is high though.
Johanna

***Agh!!! $450 for property taxes on TEN acres? Oh, I don't even want to
talk about it...

Valerie who practically has to take out a loan to pay property taxes in
Tacoma

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/3/01 1:21:08 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
I sent this to the group earlier and it never showed up so I'm sending it
again. In fact, I haven't gotten anymore email from the list today and I'm
wondering if something is wrong. I've been having problems like this lately
with AOL!

Lucy >>

I haven't recieved any e-groups mail in 2 days. I am on 3 lists. We are
alos having difficulty w/ our computer. I fixed it w/ Gateway then had to fix
something w/ AOL today. I am still getting logged off now and again though.
Frustrating!

NICKI~

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1187
messages.msgSnippet: wow, this post makes me glad to live in Tennessee. we have a 200 sq ft four bedroom home on ten acres of land and with mortgage, insurance, utilities and all,
messages.messageBody:
wow, this post makes me glad to live in Tennessee. we have a 200 sq ft four bedroom home on ten acres of land and with mortgage, insurance, utilities and all, we dont pay more than $1200 a month! It costs $25 a year for car tags. Our property tax was $450 for a year and we have no income tax. Sales tax is high though.
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: Rita B.
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com ; Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, May 02, 2001 8:02 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1187



>>***Hi Nanci. Where exactly do you want to buy land to
>>build your community?
>>Valerie in Tacoma, 20 minutes south of Federal Way
>
>Hi Valerie! We will soon be neighbors! :-) I can't
>seem to find my map of counties rght now, but we
>started out looking in Snohomish and King counties and
>then expanded to pierce and (??the Adjoining one) to
>open up more possibilities in term of the limitations
>inposed by the costs of land in Snohomish and King.
>We will be narrowing down based on a number of
>factors, after we are there to investigate things in
>person and extensively. We anticipate about a year
>(maybe more) of investigations and preparations before
>we invest in land.
>
>Nanci K.
>


HI Nancy and Val -

Val, you are a neighbor of mine as well :)
We also live in Tacoma - NE Tacoma on Dash Point

Careful - 3 attempted rapes this last week in Tacoma
Pearl St ...by the zoo, and two other areas
I forget the other 2 streets - on tonights news
5/7" male - grey hightlight hair - mid weight
35-40 years old ... have occured on main streets most during daylight hours


Nanci just a note ... I love where I live, I have a wonderful neighborhood
of awesome neighbors (example: brought us a hot homecooked meal in
a basket when we were moving in, have block party barbecues - most
are homeschoolers - AWESOME nrighborhood .... )

BUT ... I am moving out of here this summer most likely :

Reason being : Pierce county is going nuts on raising rates
Our rent is a mere $1400 a mo ... not a biggie - pretty typical
and actually a very wonderful price for the beautiful home we
have by the water, with 4 bedrooms, 3 bath, hot tub - huge floorplan etc
....
BUT .... when you add on w/s/g/gas and power
it is costing us over $2000 a mo and keeps going higher ...
we have gas heat and conserve on energy more than a lot of people
but each bill the rates are higher

and car tabs in pierce and king county are so much higher
my car is 10 yrs newer than my hubbys but registered in whatcom county
not pierce hubby registered his in pierce when we moved here
my tabs were 30$ his were almost $100
it is NUTS what they tax you on and raise down here that they dont in
other areas of WA state ... Hubby is askin his work to let him telecommute
so
we can go back to whatcom county where the air rating is the highest for
the country
(saw that on CNN the other night) and it is cheap to live ...
Just a heads up for some more things to think about ...
skagit, kitsap, thurston, mason and whatcom counties and across the
mountains
are the cheapest areas to live in WA




~ Childhood is that state which ends
the moment a puddle is first viewed
as an obstacle instead of an opportunity. ~
- Kathy Williams -


Yahoo! Groups Sponsor

Vaughnde Lee
Missoula, Montana
http://www.stampinbookworm.eboard.com

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1187
messages.msgSnippet: Val, you are a neighbor of mine as well :) We also live in Tacoma - NE Tacoma on Dash Point Careful - 3 attempted rapes this last week in Tacoma Pearl St ...by
messages.messageBody:
Val, you are a neighbor of mine as well :)
We also live in Tacoma - NE Tacoma on Dash Point

Careful - 3 attempted rapes this last week in Tacoma
Pearl St ...by the zoo, and two other areas
I forget the other 2 streets - on tonights news
5/7" male - grey hightlight hair - mid weight
35-40 years old ... have occured on main streets most during daylight hours

***Hi Rita. Yes, I woke up to this on the news this morning. Scary, but at
least the women were able to fight him off without much trouble.

Hey my brother used to live in Brown's Point, before they moved across the
country and broke his mother's heart. Not that I'm bitter. You're right, the
prices on anything around here make no sense. Power certainly shouldn't have
gone up like it did. At least the car tabs went *down*, they used to be
anywhere from $50 to over $500.

later, my husband is nuzzling me....Valerie
